question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Given these considerations, while it is not impossible for Pence to secure the nomination, the probability is relatively low compared to other potential candidates.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
The Greens–EFA (European Free Alliance) is a political group in the European Parliament known for its environmental and progressive policies. Historically, the group has not been among the largest in terms of seats. The largest groups have traditionally been the European People's Party (EPP) and the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats (S&D). In recent years, there has been an increase in environmental awareness and support for green policies across Europe, which could potentially lead to gains for the Greens–EFA. However, achieving the most seats would require a significant shift in voter support away from the traditionally larger parties, which is unlikely given the current political landscape.

Moreover, the political dynamics in the EU involve various factors, including national politics, alliances, and voter turnout, which can affect election outcomes. While the Greens–EFA may gain seats, surpassing both the EPP and S&D to hold the most seats would require an unprecedented electoral success.

Considering these factors, while the Greens–EFA may see an increase in their seat count, the probability of them holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections is low.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my last update in October 2023, ChatGPT by OpenAI is generally available in the European Union and has been widely accessible since its inception. There was a temporary issue in Italy in early 2023 due to regulatory concerns, but it was resolved, and the service was reinstated. OpenAI has shown a commitment to complying with EU regulations, and there have been no recent indications of impending restrictions or bans across the EU. The European Union has been working on AI regulations, but these are more focused on ensuring transparency and safety without outright banning AI technologies like ChatGPT. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

metadata.chain_of_thought:

1. **Historical Performance**: Czechia's past performance in Eurovision can provide insights. Czechia has qualified for the Grand Final several times, but they have also failed to qualify in some years. Their qualification rate is not among the highest, but they have had some successful entries.

2. **Song and Artist**: The quality of the song and the artist representing Czechia in 2024 is crucial. If the song has been well-received by critics and fans, it could have a higher chance of qualifying. Unfortunately, without specific information on the 2024 entry, this factor is hard to evaluate precisely.

3. **Semi-final Allocation**: The semi-final in which Czechia competes can also affect their chances. Some semi-finals are considered more competitive than others, depending on the participating countries and their historical voting patterns.

4. **Voting Patterns**: Eurovision voting can be influenced by geopolitical factors and diaspora voting. Czechia's voting allies and the presence of countries that traditionally support them can impact their chances.

5. **Current Trends**: Trends in Eurovision, such as the popularity of certain music styles or performance elements, can also play a role. If Czechia's entry aligns with current trends, it might improve their chances of qualifying.

Given these considerations, while Czechia has a decent chance of qualifying, it is not guaranteed. Their history shows variability, and without detailed information on the 2024 entry, the estimate must be based on general trends and historical data.

"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To forecast whether "Deadpool & Wolverine" will have a higher domestic box office opening than the combined total of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), we need to consider several factors:

1. **Franchise Popularity**: Both Deadpool and Wolverine are popular characters from the Marvel universe. "Deadpool" was particularly successful, with a strong fanbase and its unique R-rated humor. The combination of these two characters in a single film could attract a significant audience.

2. **Historical Performance**: "Deadpool" (2016) had a very strong opening, earning $132,434,639 domestically. "The Wolverine" (2013) had a more modest opening at $53,113,752. The combined total of $185,548,391 is a high benchmark, but not unattainable for a major superhero film.

3. **Market Trends**: The superhero genre continues to perform well at the box office, although there is some evidence of fatigue in the genre. However, unique pairings or novel entries in the genre (like "Deadpool & Wolverine") can still generate significant interest.

4. **Marketing and Hype**: The marketing campaign, release strategy, and any unique selling points (such as the first-time pairing of these characters) will play a crucial role. If the film is marketed effectively, it could exceed expectations.

5. **Release Timing**: The release date and competition from other films around the same time will also affect box office performance. If "Deadpool & Wolverine" is released during a less competitive window, it could capture a larger share of the audience.

6. **Critical Reception and Word of Mouth**: Early reviews and audience reactions can significantly impact box office performance. If the film is well-received, it could boost its opening weekend numbers.

Considering these factors, while there is potential for "Deadpool & Wolverine" to surpass the combined opening of the previous films, it is a challenging target. The novelty of the pairing and the established fanbases provide a strong foundation, but external factors like competition and market trends introduce uncertainty.

Nvidia, on the other hand, has experienced significant growth, especially due to its leadership in the GPU market and its role in AI and data center technologies. For Nvidia's market cap to surpass Apple's by June 28, 2024, several factors would need to align. Apple's diverse product line, strong brand loyalty, and consistent revenue streams provide a robust foundation that is difficult to surpass in the short term. metadata.chain_of_thought:
To determine the probability of this question resolving YES, we need to evaluate the likelihood of each of the two scenarios separately and then consider their combined probability since the question resolves YES if either scenario occurs.

(a) Trump's lead over Biden in the national polling average: As of the latest data, political polling can fluctuate significantly due to various factors such as campaign events, debates, and external events impacting public opinion. Trump's lead being between 2 and 3 points is a very narrow range. Historically, polling averages can swing by several points within short periods, making this specific range somewhat unlikely. Additionally, as of the last known data, Biden and Trump have had close polling numbers, with neither consistently maintaining a lead in that specific range.

(b) Nvidia's market capitalization being larger than Apple's: As of the latest data, Apple has a significantly larger market capitalization than Nvidia. For Nvidia to overtake Apple, it would require either a substantial increase in Nvidia's stock price, a significant decrease in Apple's stock price, or a combination of both. While Nvidia has been experiencing growth, particularly due to advancements in AI and semiconductor demand, surpassing Apple's market cap is a considerable challenge. Market dynamics can change rapidly, but the gap is substantial enough to make this scenario less likely without a major shift in market conditions or company performance.

Given that only one of these conditions needs to be met for the question to resolve YES, we should consider the independent probabilities of each scenario and use the formula for the probability of the union of two independent events: P(A or B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A)P(B).

Assuming a low probability for each scenario individually (e.g., 0.1 for Trump's lead and 0.05 for Nvidia's market cap), we get:
P(A or B) = 0.1 + 0.05 - (0.1 * 0.05) = 0.145.

Based on this analysis, while it is possible for Trump's lead to fall within this specific range, the combination of potential volatility and the narrowness of the range makes it statistically less likely without strong supporting trends in the months leading up to July 2024.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

metadata.chain_of_thought:

1. **Geopolitical Context**: Israel and Iran have a long-standing adversarial relationship, with tensions often flaring over Iran's nuclear program and regional influence. Israel has previously conducted covert operations and airstrikes aimed at Iranian targets, particularly in Syria, to counter perceived threats.

2. **Historical Precedents**: Israel has been known to carry out targeted operations against Iranian interests, though these are often covert and not officially acknowledged. There have been instances where Israeli operations reportedly resulted in casualties, but these typically occur in regions outside of Iran, such as Syria.

3. **Current Tensions**: As of the latest data, tensions remain high between Israel and Iran, with both countries engaging in rhetoric and actions that suggest a volatile relationship. However, a direct attack within Iran's borders leading to multiple casualties would be a significant escalation.

4. **Diplomatic and Strategic Considerations**: Any direct attack within Iran could have major diplomatic repercussions and potentially lead to broader conflict. Israel would likely weigh these risks heavily before undertaking such an operation.

5. **Timing**: The question has a short timeframe, with only a few weeks remaining until the resolution date. This limits the likelihood of such a significant event occurring, as planning and executing an operation of this magnitude would typically require more time.

Given these factors, while the possibility of an Israeli attack exists, the specific scenario of an attack within Iran leading to at least five deaths before May 1, 2024, is less likely due to the potential for severe diplomatic fallout and the limited timeframe.

question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
Reasoning: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) measures the market's expectation of 3-month volatility implied by S&P 500 index options. To determine if the VXVCLS will be higher year-over-year on July 20, 2024, we need to consider several factors that can influence market volatility.

1. **Current Market Conditions**: As of April 2024, assessing the current market volatility and economic conditions is crucial. If the market is experiencing high volatility due to economic uncertainty, geopolitical tensions, or unexpected financial events, there might be a higher likelihood of continued or increased volatility.

2. **Historical Volatility Trends**: Historically, market volatility can be influenced by specific periods of economic stress or recovery. Comparing the historical patterns around the same time in previous years can provide insights into potential future movements.

3. **Economic Indicators**: Key economic indicators such as inflation rates, interest rates, employment data, and GDP growth can impact investor sentiment and market volatility. Any significant changes in these indicators leading up to July 2024 could influence the VXVCLS.

4. **Corporate Earnings and Financial Reports**: The period around mid-July often coincides with the release of corporate earnings reports. Positive or negative surprises in earnings can lead to increased market volatility.

5. **Global Events**: Unforeseen global events, such as geopolitical conflicts, natural disasters, or pandemics, can lead to spikes in market volatility.

Considering these factors, if the market is currently experiencing or is expected to experience higher volatility due to any of the above reasons, there is a higher probability that the VXVCLS will be higher year-over-year. However, if the market stabilizes and economic conditions improve, the index may be lower.

Probability: 0.55

metadata.chain_of_thought:

(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) being higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, depends on market conditions, investor sentiment, and economic factors. Volatility indices like the VXVCLS are influenced by macroeconomic events, geopolitical tensions, and market trends. While tensions are high, such an event is not guaranteed to occur within the specified timeframe.

To calculate the probability of either event occurring, we consider the probability of each independently and then use the formula for the probability of at least one of two independent events occurring: P(A or B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A)P(B).

Let's assume:
- Probability of (a) = 0.4 (reflecting uncertainty in market volatility)
- Probability of (b) = 0.2 (reflecting the geopolitical risk but recognizing the rarity of such events)

Using the formula: P(A or B) = 0.4 + 0.2 - (0.4 * 0.2) = 0.52

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

metadata.chain_of_thought:
As of October 2023, President Joe Biden has been serving as the President of the United States since January 20, 2021. Historically, it is uncommon for sitting U.S. Presidents to leave office before the end of their term due to resignation or other reasons. The primary reasons a President might not complete their term include resignation, impeachment and removal, death, or incapacitation. 

1. **Resignation**: There is no current indication or significant political pressure suggesting that President Biden is considering resignation. Historically, resignation is a rare occurrence, with Richard Nixon being the only U.S. President to resign from office.

2. **Impeachment and Removal**: While impeachment is a political process that could theoretically remove a President from office, it requires a majority in the House and a two-thirds majority in the Senate to convict and remove a President. Given the current political landscape and the Democratic Party's control of the Senate, it seems unlikely that such a process would be successful against President Biden before July 2024.

3. **Health Concerns**: President Biden is the oldest person to assume the presidency, which naturally raises questions about his health. However, there have been no public indications of severe health issues that would prevent him from serving through July 2024. The 25th Amendment allows for temporary transfer of power in case of incapacitation, but this does not affect the resolution of the question as it specifies that temporary transfers do not cause a YES resolution.

4. **Death**: While this is always a possibility for any individual, there is no specific reason to believe this is more likely for Biden than any other President at this point in time.

In summary, considering the historical precedent, current political environment, and lack of specific indicators suggesting otherwise, it is reasonable to estimate a high probability that President Biden will remain in office through the end of July 2024.

5. **External Events**: Unforeseen events, such as economic changes, national crises, or significant political developments, could shift voter preferences and party dynamics.

Considering these factors, while DeSantis is a strong candidate, the presence of Donald Trump and the complexities of party dynamics reduce the likelihood of DeSantis securing the nomination. However, he remains one of the top contenders.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 and (b) Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To estimate the probability of both conditions (a) and (b) occurring, we need to evaluate each condition separately and then combine them.

(a) Biden remaining President through the end of July 2024: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, Joe Biden is in relatively good health for his age and there have been no indications of any significant health issues that might force him to resign. The likelihood of a sitting president resigning or being removed from office is historically low unless there are extraordinary circumstances. Therefore, the probability of Biden remaining in office through July 2024 is relatively high.

(b) Ron DeSantis being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: Ron DeSantis has been a prominent figure in the Republican Party and was considered a leading contender for the nomination. However, the Republican primary field can be competitive and unpredictable, with other candidates such as Donald Trump potentially influencing the outcome. As of October 2023, DeSantis's chances would depend on his campaign performance, political dynamics, and the decisions of Republican voters and delegates. While he is a strong contender, there is significant uncertainty, making the probability of him securing the nomination moderate.

To estimate the combined probability of both events occurring, we multiply the probabilities of each event. Assuming a high probability for (a) and a moderate probability for (b), the combined probability would be lower than either individual probability.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden remain President through the end of July 2024 or Ron DeSantis become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); this resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution) OR (b) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election. All other candidates will resolve as NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To resolve YES, either Joe Biden must remain President through the end of July 2024, or Ron DeSantis must become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

1. **Joe Biden's Presidency**: As of October 2023, Joe Biden is serving as the President of the United States. He has announced his intention to run for a second term, indicating a strong commitment to remain in office. Historically, sitting presidents who seek reelection typically remain in office unless there are unforeseen circumstances such as health issues or significant political scandals leading to resignation or impeachment. While Biden's age and health are often discussed, there are currently no indications that he will not be able to serve through July 2024. Thus, the probability of him remaining President through the specified period is relatively high.

2. **Ron DeSantis as the Republican Nominee**: Ron DeSantis, as of the latest updates, is a prominent figure in the Republican Party and was considered a potential frontrunner for the 2024 Republican nomination. However, the political landscape can change rapidly, and he faces competition from other candidates, including former President Donald Trump. The nomination process is inherently uncertain and competitive, but DeSantis remains a strong contender.

Given these factors, the probability of at least one of these conditions being met is quite high. Biden's continuation as President is more likely than DeSantis securing the nomination, but both are plausible outcomes.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To estimate the probability of Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, we need to consider several factors:

1. **Current Polling Trends**: As of the latest data, Trump has a lead of 2.4 points over Biden. This is within the range specified by the question, suggesting that the current trend is favorable for a resolution of YES.

2. **Polling Volatility**: National polling averages can fluctuate due to various factors such as political events, debates, economic conditions, and changes in public sentiment. The volatility of polling data means that even if Trump is currently within the specified range, his lead could easily increase or decrease outside of this range by July 15, 2024.

3. **Historical Context**: Historically, polling leads can shift significantly over a short period, especially as election day approaches and campaigns intensify. Both Trump and Biden have strong bases of support, and their relative standings can be influenced by campaign strategies and external events.

4. **538's Methodology**: 538 uses a sophisticated model that aggregates and weights various polls, which tends to smooth out some of the volatility seen in individual polls. This could mean that sudden shifts in individual polls might not immediately reflect in the national average.

5. **External Factors**: Unexpected events (e.g., economic changes, international incidents, or major political developments) could impact voter preferences and thus the polling averages.

Given the current lead and the factors above, while there is a reasonable chance that Trump's lead could remain within the specified range, the inherent uncertainties and potential for change in the political landscape suggest that the probability is moderate rather than high.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of an athlete winning more than one medal in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, we need to consider the structure of the tennis events and the historical precedent. In the Olympics, tennis medals are awarded in the following categories: Men's Singles, Women's Singles, Men's Doubles, Women's Doubles, and Mixed Doubles. Therefore, an athlete can potentially compete in multiple events. Historically, it is not uncommon for top players to compete in both singles and doubles events. For instance, at the 2016 Rio Olympics, Venus Williams won a silver medal in mixed doubles and has previously won both singles and doubles medals in past Olympics. Similarly, Andy Murray won gold in men's singles and a silver in mixed doubles in 2012. Given the nature of top tennis players often participating in multiple events, and the fact that the Olympics is a prestigious event where top players are highly motivated to perform well, there is a reasonable chance that an athlete could win more than one medal. The probability is further increased if a player is highly ranked and has a history of success in both singles and doubles formats. Considering these factors, the likelihood of an athlete winning more than one medal in tennis at the 2024 Olympics is significant.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

metadata.chain_of_thought:
The concept of "Individual Neutral Athletes" typically refers to athletes who compete independently of their national teams, often due to political reasons, sanctions, or other circumstances that prevent their countries from officially participating under their flags. The most recent and notable example is the participation of Russian and Belarusian athletes as neutrals due to the ongoing geopolitical situation. Historically, the number of medals won by such athletes has been relatively low compared to the total medal count at the Olympics. For instance, at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics, Russian athletes competed as the "Russian Olympic Committee" (ROC) and won a significant number of medals, but they were not considered "Individual Neutral Athletes" in the sense described here.

The likelihood of Individual Neutral Athletes winning 21 or more gold medals depends on several factors, including the number of such athletes allowed to compete, the sports they participate in, and their competitiveness. Given that the Olympics typically feature strong national teams with established training programs and support, it is challenging for a group of neutral athletes to collectively win a large number of gold medals. Additionally, the IOC's regulations and the political climate will influence how many athletes compete as neutrals.

Considering these factors, it seems unlikely that Individual Neutral Athletes will win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. While it is possible for a few outstanding athletes to win multiple gold medals, the threshold of 21 is quite high without a large contingent of neutrals.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, and (2) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (2) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for the second condition will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. The market for the second condition will resolve immediately to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To evaluate the probability of this question resolving as "Yes," we need to assess both conditions separately and then combine them. 1. Condition 1: An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Traditionally, tennis at the Olympics offers medals in singles and doubles (men's, women's, and mixed doubles). Winning more than one medal in tennis is challenging but not unprecedented. A player would need to compete and excel in multiple categories. Notable players with strong track records in both singles and doubles, such as Novak Djokovic or Serena Williams (if they participate), could potentially achieve this. However, the depth of competition and the physical demands make it a relatively rare occurrence. Historically, few players achieve this feat, but it remains possible. 2. Condition 2: Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals. The term "Individual Neutral Athletes" usually refers to athletes who compete under a neutral flag, often due to sanctions on their home country. In recent Olympics, such as Tokyo 2020, athletes from Russia competed under the ROC (Russian Olympic Committee) banner and won 20 gold medals. The number 21 is a high target, and achieving this would require an exceptionally strong performance across multiple sports. Given the historical context and recent performances, while challenging, it is within the realm of possibility if a large contingent of high-performing athletes competes under a neutral designation. Combining these assessments, the probability of both events occurring is the product of their individual probabilities. While both are challenging, neither is impossible. However, the conjunction of both events happening is less likely than each occurring independently.

question.title: Will either an athlete win more than one medal for tennis or Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for (b) will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, (b) will resolve immediately to "Yes".

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To determine the probability of this question resolving as "Yes," we need to consider both conditions separately and then the likelihood of either occurring.

(a) For an athlete to win more than one medal in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, we need to consider the tennis events available and the historical precedent. Tennis at the Olympics typically includes men's and women's singles, men's and women's doubles, and mixed doubles. Historically, it's uncommon but not impossible for a player to win multiple medals, usually by competing in both singles and doubles or mixed doubles. Notable players who are strong contenders in multiple events might increase the likelihood, but it remains a relatively rare occurrence.

(b) Individual Neutral Athletes (INA) winning 21 or more gold medals is another aspect to consider. INAs are typically athletes from countries facing sanctions or other issues that prevent them from competing under their national flag. The number of gold medals they might win depends on the number and quality of athletes competing under this designation. Historically, INAs have not been a dominant force in terms of gold medal counts, as they often represent a smaller pool of athletes. However, if a country with a strong Olympic tradition and a large number of high-performing athletes is competing under this designation, the probability could increase.

Considering these factors, the probability of either (a) or (b) occurring is relatively low but not negligible. The rarity of multiple tennis medals per athlete and the historical performance of INAs suggest that while either event is possible, neither is particularly likely on its own. However, since the question resolves "Yes" if either condition is met, the combined probability is slightly higher than each individual probability.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of Joe Biden having an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical Precedent: Biden's previous interviews, such as the one on The Howard Stern Show, have lasted over 45 minutes. However, many of his other interviews, including those with Stephanopoulos and on Jimmy Fallon, have been shorter. This suggests that while longer interviews are possible, they are not the norm. 2. Media Engagement: As the President, Biden is likely to have multiple media engagements, especially given the political climate and the upcoming elections. However, the format of these engagements is crucial. Press conferences, speeches, and rallies do not count, which limits the opportunities for qualifying interviews. 3. Scheduling and Availability: The time frame until the end of July 2024 is relatively short. Given Biden's busy schedule, especially with the demands of the presidency and the campaign trail, finding time for a lengthy in-person interview might be challenging. 4. Media Strategy: The decision to participate in a long-form interview will depend on Biden's media strategy and the perceived benefits of such an engagement. If his team believes that a long interview would positively impact his public image or campaign, it might be more likely to occur. 5. External Events: Unforeseen events, such as significant political developments or crises, could either necessitate a long interview or make it less feasible. Considering these factors, while it is possible for Biden to have a qualifying interview, the constraints and typical patterns suggest it is not highly probable. However, given his past appearance on The Howard Stern Show, it remains within the realm of possibility.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To estimate the probability that Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, we need to consider several factors. These include historical polling trends, the current political climate, and the reliability of polling data.

1. **Historical Polling Trends**: Historically, national polling averages can fluctuate significantly as the election approaches, influenced by events, debates, and campaign strategies. Trump's lead or deficit has varied in past elections, and small leads or deficits are common.

2. **Current Political Climate**: The political climate leading up to July 2024 will play a crucial role. Factors such as economic performance, major legislative achievements or failures, and international events can influence voter sentiment. As of the latest data, if Trump's lead is close to 2.4 points (as of July 5, 2024), it suggests a competitive race but does not necessarily imply a significant shift to a 3-4 point lead.

3. **Polling Reliability**: Polls have margins of error, and different pollsters may have varying methodologies. 538 aggregates these polls to provide a more stable average, but this average can still be subject to sudden changes due to new data or major events.

4. **Recent Trends**: If recent trends show a steady increase in Trump's lead, it could suggest a higher probability of reaching a 3-4 point lead. Conversely, if the trend is stable or decreasing, the probability would be lower.

Given these considerations, while it is possible for Trump's lead to fall within the specified range, it is a relatively narrow band (only a 1-point range). This makes it less likely compared to a broader range. Therefore, while not impossible, the probability should reflect the uncertainty and variability inherent in polling data.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, AND (2) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, released before the end of July 2024. Qualifying interviews include appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 Minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls do not count. 

(2) According to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The value will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the probability of both conditions occurring, we need to evaluate each condition separately and then consider their joint probability.

1. **Joe Biden's In-Person Interview**: Joe Biden, as a sitting president, frequently participates in interviews and media appearances. It is common for presidents to engage in lengthy interviews, especially during an election year to communicate their policies and respond to public concerns. Given the time frame until the end of July 2024, it is quite plausible that Biden will participate in at least one qualifying interview of 45+ minutes. This condition seems likely to be fulfilled.

2. **Trump's Lead Over Biden According to 538's National Polling Average**: As of the latest data, the political landscape is quite volatile, with polling numbers frequently changing. A lead of greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points is a very specific range. While it's possible for Trump to have a lead within this range on July 15, 2024, polling averages are subject to significant fluctuations due to various factors such as campaign events, debates, and external political developments. The specificity of this range makes this condition less certain.

The joint probability of both conditions occurring requires both to be true simultaneously. While Biden's interview is likely, the specific polling lead range adds uncertainty. Therefore, the overall probability is reduced by the uncertainty in the polling condition.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Joe Biden have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes, or (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be in-person and feature at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed. Qualifying appearances include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, but not press conferences, speeches, rallies, etc. 

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To determine the probability of either event (a) or (b) occurring by July 2024, we need to assess each scenario separately and then combine their probabilities.

(a) Joe Biden having an in-person interview for 45+ minutes: Joe Biden, as a sitting President, frequently engages in media appearances and interviews. While 45-minute interviews are not as common as shorter segments, they are certainly possible, especially in the context of long-form interviews on platforms like 60 Minutes or podcasts. Given the lead-up to the 2024 election, it's plausible that Biden would engage in such a format to communicate his policies and campaign messages.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average: Polling data can fluctuate significantly, especially in the months leading up to an election. While Trump has had leads over Biden in various polls, the specific range of a lead greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points is quite narrow. However, given the volatility of polling and the polarized nature of the electorate, this scenario is within the realm of possibility.

The probability of either event (a) or (b) occurring is the union of the probabilities of each event. Since these events are independent, the probability of at least one occurring is 1 minus the probability of neither occurring. Assuming a moderate probability for both (a) and (b) due to their individual plausibility, we can estimate:

- Probability of (a) occurring: 0.6
- Probability of (b) occurring: 0.3

The probability of neither (a) nor (b) occurring is (1 - 0.6) * (1 - 0.3) = 0.28. Therefore, the probability of either (a) or (b) occurring is 1 - 0.28 = 0.72.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought:
As of my last update in October 2023, Nikki Haley is a prominent figure within the Republican Party, having served as the U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations and as the Governor of South Carolina. However, there are several factors that influence the likelihood of her becoming the Republican nominee for the 2024 Presidential Election.

1. **Current Political Landscape**: The Republican field for the 2024 election is likely to be competitive. Other potential candidates, such as Donald Trump, Ron DeSantis, and Mike Pence, have significant support within the party. Trump, in particular, maintains a strong base and influence over the party, which could overshadow other candidates like Haley.

2. **Polling and Support**: As of now, polling data generally shows Trump and DeSantis as leading figures in the Republican primary race. Nikki Haley has not consistently polled as a frontrunner, which could indicate challenges in securing the nomination.

3. **Party Dynamics**: The Republican Party is experiencing internal dynamics and shifts, with some factions seeking a continuation of Trump's policies and others looking for a new direction. Haley's positioning within these dynamics will be crucial.

4. **Campaign Strategy and Resources**: Haley's ability to mount a strong campaign, including fundraising and building a robust ground game, will be essential for her chances. Her past roles and experience could be advantageous, but she needs to effectively communicate her vision to the Republican base.

5. **Uncertainties and Variables**: The political environment can change rapidly, with external events and shifts in public opinion potentially altering the landscape. New candidates might emerge, or existing ones might drop out, affecting the probability of different outcomes.

Given these considerations, while Nikki Haley is a notable contender, the probability of her securing the nomination is currently lower compared to some other potential candidates.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:

2. **Historical Context**: Historically, national polling averages can change significantly over time, especially as the election date approaches and more voters make up their minds. 3. **Polling Variability**: Polling averages are subject to variability due to sampling errors, methodology differences, and the inherent unpredictability of voter behavior. A lead within a narrow range (3 to 4 points) is particularly sensitive to these factors.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The context provided suggests that there is significant unrest among some House Democrats regarding the plan to nominate President Biden early, as evidenced by the drafting of a letter opposing this plan. Rep. Jared Huffman's involvement and the description of "dozens" of Democrats organizing to speak out indicate that there is already a substantial group within the party that is unhappy with the current strategy. While the exact number of lawmakers currently supporting the letter is unspecified, the fact that it is being circulated and has been reported by a major outlet like Politico suggests that it is gaining traction. Given the political climate and the potential for dissent within the party, it is plausible that at least 20 Democratic lawmakers could sign such a letter before the specified date. However, internal party dynamics, pressure from party leadership, and strategic considerations could influence the final number of signatories. Overall, while there is a strong possibility of reaching the required number of signatures, it is not guaranteed.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Reasoning: Historically, swimming has been a sport where athletes can win multiple gold medals due to the variety of events available. question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the probability of at least five countries winning their debut gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, we should consider several factors:

1. **Historical Context**: Historically, the number of countries winning their first gold medal in any given Olympics is relatively low. For instance, at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics, only two countries (Bermuda and the Philippines) won their first-ever gold medals.

2. **Participation and New Sports**: The Paris 2024 Olympics will feature a broad range of sports, including some new events which might provide opportunities for countries that have not previously won gold. However, the introduction of new sports does not guarantee new countries winning gold, as established countries with strong sports programs often dominate even in new events.

3. **Emerging Sports Nations**: Some countries have been investing heavily in sports infrastructure and training, which could lead to improved performances. However, the leap from being a competitive nation to winning a gold medal is significant and not easily achieved in a short timeframe.

4. **Number of Competing Nations**: With over 200 countries participating, the odds may seem favorable, but the reality is that most medals are concentrated among a few dominant countries with strong Olympic traditions.

5. **Current Trends and Predictions**: There are no significant indications or trends suggesting a surge in new countries winning gold medals in 2024 compared to previous Olympics.

Given these considerations, the likelihood of five or more countries winning their debut gold medal seems low. It is rare for such a high number of countries to achieve their first gold in a single Olympics, based on historical patterns and the competitive nature of the Games.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. (b) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To determine the probability of the question resolving as YES, we need to evaluate the likelihood of both conditions (a) and (b) being satisfied.

(a) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events:
Swimming is traditionally a sport where athletes can win multiple medals due to the variety of events (e.g., different strokes and distances). In recent Olympics, swimmers like Michael Phelps and Katie Ledecky have won multiple golds. This trend suggests a high probability that a swimmer could again win the most gold medals at the Paris Olympics.

(b) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics:
Historically, a few countries win their debut gold medals at each Olympic Games, but reaching a number as high as five is less common. While the Olympics often see new countries winning gold, achieving this in a single edition requires either a significant number of new countries participating or existing nations improving significantly. The unpredictability of sports means this is possible, but not highly probable.

Considering the above points, condition (a) is relatively likely, but condition (b) is less so. Therefore, the overall probability of both conditions being satisfied simultaneously is reduced by the lower likelihood of condition (b).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the probability of at least 20 House or Senate Democrats signing a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, we need to consider several factors. Firstly, the context provided indicates that there is already some level of organized dissent within the Democratic Party, with Rep. Jared Huffman involved in circulating a draft letter. This suggests that there is a significant level of concern among some Democrats about the nomination process. Secondly, the fact that Huffman has declined to confirm the existence of the letter could indicate strategic considerations, such as waiting for more support before making the letter public. Thirdly, the political climate and recent events, such as the attempted assassination on former President Trump, may have heightened tensions and concerns about the future of Biden's candidacy, potentially motivating more Democrats to voice their opposition.

Given these factors, the likelihood of reaching at least 20 signatures seems plausible. While there is no guarantee that all dissenting members will choose to sign a public letter, the existence of organized efforts and the current political environment suggest that there is a reasonable chance of achieving the required number of signatures.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: A brokered convention occurs when no single candidate has secured a majority of delegates before the convention, leading to multiple rounds of voting. Historically, brokered conventions have been rare in modern US politics due to the primary system, where candidates typically secure the necessary delegates before the convention. The last brokered convention for the Democrats was in 1952. For the 2024 Democratic primary, President Joe Biden, as the incumbent, is likely the presumptive nominee, reducing the chances of a contested or brokered convention. Additionally, the Democratic National Committee (DNC) has mechanisms to prevent such scenarios, favoring a streamlined process that avoids multiple voting rounds. Given these factors, the likelihood of a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024 is low.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

metadata.chain_of_thought:
Reasoning: The term "Individual Neutral Athletes" (INAs) typically refers to athletes who compete independently of any national team, often due to political reasons or sanctions against their home countries. In recent history, the most notable example of such athletes were the "Olympic Athletes from Russia" who competed under a neutral flag due to doping sanctions. The ability of INAs to win medals, particularly gold ones, depends heavily on the number of such athletes allowed to compete and their competitiveness in their respective sports.

For the Paris 2024 Olympics, several factors will influence the likelihood of INAs winning 15 or more gold medals:

1. **Participation and Eligibility**: The number of INAs allowed to compete and their eligibility in various sports will significantly impact their chances. If a large contingent of high-caliber athletes is permitted to compete as INAs, the probability increases.

2. **Historical Performance**: Historically, neutral athletes have had varied success. For example, during the 2018 Winter Olympics, the Olympic Athletes from Russia won 2 gold medals. However, the Summer Olympics generally have more events and opportunities for medals.

3. **Events and Competitiveness**: The sports in which INAs typically compete and their competitiveness relative to other top athletes are crucial. If INAs are primarily competing in sports where they traditionally excel, this increases their chances.

4. **Political and Regulatory Environment**: The political climate and decisions by the IOC regarding participation can affect the number of INAs and their chances of winning.

Given these considerations, while it is possible for INAs to win 15 or more gold medals, it would require a significant number of high-performing athletes to compete under the neutral banner. Historically, achieving such a number would be unprecedented for INAs in a single Olympic Games, especially considering the potential limitations on the number of athletes and events they can participate in.

Given these considerations, while both scenarios are possible, the combination of both occurring simultaneously is less likely due to the high thresholds set by each condition. question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: Liz Cheney, a prominent Republican figure, has been known for her critical stance against former President Donald Trump, which has put her at odds with many within her party. The Republican base has largely remained supportive of Trump, and his influence in the party is significant. Cheney's criticism of Trump and her role in the January 6th Committee have further alienated her from the mainstream Republican leadership and base, who are likely to have substantial influence in the selection of the 2024 nominee. Given the current political climate and the Republican party's apparent preference for candidates aligned with Trump, it seems unlikely that Cheney would secure the nomination. Additionally, there are other potential candidates who are more aligned with the current direction of the party and have broader support among Republican voters. Therefore, while it is not impossible for Cheney to be the nominee, it is highly improbable given the present circumstances.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The Identity and Democracy (ID) political group is a right-wing populist and Eurosceptic political group in the European Parliament. Historically, the ID group has not been the largest political group in the European Parliament. The largest groups have typically been the European People's Party (EPP) and the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats (S&D), with the Renew Europe group also holding significant influence. Thirdly, the ID group is composed of parties from several countries, which may face challenges in maintaining cohesion and gaining additional seats. Therefore, the probability of the ID political group holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections is relatively low.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To forecast whether Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, we need to consider several factors:

1. **Historical Polling Trends**: Historically, polling averages can fluctuate significantly in the lead-up to an election. Both Trump and Biden have had varying leads in different periods, influenced by current events, economic conditions, and political developments.

2. **Current Political Climate**: As of the latest data available (October 2023), the political climate is highly polarized, and both candidates have strong bases of support. However, external factors such as economic performance, international events, and domestic policies can shift public opinion rapidly.

3. **Polling Variability and Margin of Error**: Polling averages are subject to variability and often include a margin of error. A lead of 2 to 3 points is relatively narrow, suggesting that even minor swings in voter sentiment could place Trump's lead outside this range.

4. **538's Methodology**: 538 aggregates polls and applies adjustments based on historical accuracy and bias. This methodology can smooth out some fluctuations but is not immune to sudden changes in public opinion.

5. **Impact of Third-party Candidates**: The presence of third-party candidates could impact the national polling averages, potentially narrowing or widening the lead between Trump and Biden.

Considering these factors, while it is possible for Trump to have a lead within the specified range on the exact date, the narrowness of the range and the inherent volatility in polling make it uncertain. The probability is influenced by the potential for minor events to significantly alter the polling landscape.

question.title: Will Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the probability of Switzerland qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, we need to consider several factors. Historically, Switzerland has had a mixed record in Eurovision, with some years of strong performances and others where they did not qualify for the final. Their recent performance trends, song selection, and the popularity of their entries can all influence their chances.

1. **Historical Performance**: In recent years, Switzerland has had some success in Eurovision, notably finishing in the top positions in 2019 and 2021. This indicates a potential upward trend in their performance quality.

2. **Song and Artist Selection**: The choice of song and artist is crucial. If Switzerland selects a strong entry with broad appeal, it increases their chances of qualifying. Information about their 2024 entry, such as its reception by fans and critics, would be useful, but assuming they maintain a competitive standard as in recent years, this could be favorable.

3. **Competition**: The competition in the semi-final can vary significantly. If Switzerland is placed in a semi-final with less competitive entries, their chances improve. Conversely, if they face many strong contenders, it could be more challenging.

4. **Voting Patterns**: Eurovision has a complex voting system involving both jury and public votes. Switzerland's ability to appeal to both juries and the public can affect their qualification chances.

5. **Current Trends and News**: Any recent news about Switzerland's preparations, such as public reactions to their entry or promotional activities, could also impact their probability of qualifying.

Considering these factors, while there are uncertainties, Switzerland has shown they can produce competitive entries. Therefore, I would estimate a moderately high probability of Switzerland qualifying for the Grand Final.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Reasoning: The Crimean Bridge, also known as the Kerch Strait Bridge, has been a focal point of strategic and symbolic significance in the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine. It connects the Russian mainland with Crimea, a region annexed by Russia in 2014, which is not recognized by Ukraine and much of the international community. The bridge has been targeted before, notably in October 2022, when an explosion partially damaged it. Given its importance, the bridge remains a potential target for Ukrainian forces or other actors opposing Russian control over Crimea. As of the current date, the conflict between Russia and Ukraine is ongoing, with hostilities continuing in various forms. There have been repeated statements from Ukrainian officials regarding their intent to reclaim Crimea and disrupt Russian supply lines, of which the Crimean Bridge is a critical component. Additionally, the bridge's symbolic value makes it a high-profile target for any action aimed at undermining Russian authority in the region. However, the likelihood of an attack also depends on several factors, including the military capabilities and priorities of Ukrainian forces, the level of international support or constraints they face, and the defensive measures put in place by Russia to protect the bridge. The period in question is relatively short, from May 2, 2024, to July 1, 2024, which may limit the window of opportunity for any such attack. Considering these factors, while there is a plausible risk of an attack on the Crimean Bridge within the specified timeframe, the certainty of such an event occurring is not absolute. The probability must account for both the strategic motivations and the practical challenges involved in executing such an operation.

question.title: Will USD be worth >= 145 JPY (yen) at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of USD being worth 145 JPY or more at the close on August 9th, 2024, we need to consider several factors influencing the USD/JPY exchange rate. 1. **Current Trends and Historical Data**: As of the last available data in October 2023, the USD/JPY exchange rate has been influenced by several macroeconomic factors, including interest rate differentials between the US and Japan, economic growth prospects, and geopolitical events. If the trend leading up to July 2024 shows a strengthening USD or a weakening JPY, it could suggest a higher likelihood of the exchange rate reaching or exceeding 145 JPY. 2. **Monetary Policy**: The US Federal Reserve and the Bank of Japan's monetary policies significantly impact the exchange rate. If the Federal Reserve continues to raise interest rates or maintains a relatively higher interest rate compared to Japan, this could strengthen the USD against the JPY. Conversely, if the Bank of Japan maintains its low or negative interest rate policy, it might weaken the JPY further. 3. **Economic Indicators**: Key economic indicators such as GDP growth, inflation rates, and trade balances for both the US and Japan will play a crucial role. Stronger economic performance in the US relative to Japan could support a stronger USD. 4. **Geopolitical Factors**: Any geopolitical tensions or disruptions in Asia or globally can lead to currency fluctuations. The JPY is often considered a safe-haven currency, but significant geopolitical risks could either strengthen or weaken it depending on the context. 5. **Market Sentiment and Speculation**: Currency markets are also influenced by speculative activities and market sentiment. If traders anticipate a stronger USD, this could drive the exchange rate higher. Considering these factors, if the USD/JPY exchange rate has been trending towards 145 or higher in the months leading up to August 2024, and the macroeconomic environment supports a stronger USD or weaker JPY, the probability of the exchange rate being at least 145 on August 9th, 2024, would be higher.
